item.title: Building F# 3.0 Projects on a Build Server WITHOUT Visual Studio
item.description: We added an F# project in our solution and builds started failing. It was the same with Team City and TFS (don’t ask why we have both). The reason was simple – the F# tools weren’t on the build server. A quick tweet suggested the general approach is to install VS on the build server. For irrational and non-sensical hygiene issues, I prefer not to. So, I started a little experiment…
